html.p: MSMQ is a queuing system for message passing systems. It allows messages to be passed from one sub-system to another, even if they are on remote servers. A message can be as simple as a text string or as complex as a serialized binary .NET object. Since there is no method of knowing in advance in what format the messages are going to be sent, we require a message handler to decode the contents of each message. The message handler is a .NET Assembly that is placed in the bin\MessageHandlers directory of the SA-ModularInput-MSMQ app. Once integrated, the class of the message handler is provided during the input definition.
To assist in your development efforts, a complete example has been provided as a Visual Studio 2012 solution on GitHub. This solution can be cloned from GitHub.
Once you have your completed assembly, copy the DLL into the SA-ModularInput-MSMQ\bin\MessageHandlers directory.
